Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Pentateuch with Hafṭarot and the Five Scrolls.

msItem.title: Torah, hafṭarot u-megilot תורה, הפטרות ומגילות

collation.p: 38 quires of mostly 8 leaves each. Quires marked with catchwords on the last page.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Square Ashkenazi script of the 13th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: 2v The Ten Commandments table in a colour-decorated panel - later addition.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Bible. Hebrew. Vol. I. Brit. Mus. Additional 9401.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Adam Clarke (b. 1762, d. 1832), Wesleyan Methodist minister and scholar. His bookplate with Greek inscription: ho theos agape estin (folio [i verso]). This codex, together with nine other manuscripts (Additional 9398-9407), was acquired by the British Museum in 1834, once the property of the Hagen family and then bought from Adam Clarke.
